messages.message: Is there a way I can keep a few libraries installed in my sandbox. I think my sandbox got rebuilt today and I noticed a few packages vanished (there are not in my homedir so my snapshot didn't have it). This has happened a few times already. Can I request some libraries be added to the base image? Or is there a way I can layer something on top? Specifically, I want `tmux` and `emacs`.
Yeah, this is easy to achieve now. There is a dockerfile for the base image that we can add these to. I can show you tomorrow!

~Just noting other things I had to install manually after my re-build:~

1. ~Setup a python venv~
2. ~`sudo apt install python3-venv python3-pip`~
3. ~`python -m ensurepip`~
4. ~`pip install pre-commit`~

~Okay, never mind, I think something is just really borked with my sandbox.~

~Go vanished again. It was there two hours ago.~

I'm following up with Sean in another thread about how borked my sandbox is. https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1741747970810389?thread_ts=1741726594.603909&cid=C05L87V014J

Hopefully I don't have to install any of these things once it's fixed.
